statement.tex: \text{Find the following integral}\\ \int \sec x \left(\sec x + \tan x\right)dx

step.tex:
\int \sec x \left(\sec x + \tan x\right)dx \\ \qquad\qquad\quad= \int \left(\sec^2 x + \sec x \cdot \tan x \right)dx\\ \qquad\qquad\quad=\int \sec^2 x \,dx + \int \sec x\cdot \tan x \,dx\\ \qquad\qquad\quad= \tan x + \sec x + C\\
\text{Here C is constant of Integration}\\

choices.tex: \int \sec x \left(\sec x + \tan x\right)dx= -\tan x + \sec x + C
\int \sec x \left(\sec x + \tan x\right)dx= \tan x - \sec x + C
\int \sec x \left(\sec x + \tan x\right)dx= \tan^2 x + \sec x + C
\int \sec x \left(\sec x + \tan x\right)dx= \tan x + \sec x + C
